name: Rustic Ribbon
description:
Endless Pursuit paracord bracelets are made with pride in the PNW, by a person living with Multiple Sclerosis. Your products will be custom woven by one of our talented weavers containing up to ten feet of cord. Orange, the color for MS awareness, is intricately woven into each design.

Paracord or 550 cord is one of the most important things that you'd like to have in an emergency situation. It was originally used by paratroopers as suspension lines for their parachutes during World War II. Most military units have been using paracord for years to tie down gear on vehicles, securing camouflage nets, and carrying small but important items. In 1997, paracord was even used by astronauts during STS-82 Space Shuttle Discovery mission to repair the Hubble Space Telescope. You can use paracord to repair gear or torn clothing, replace broken shoe laces, apply a tourniquet, make a splint or use the inner strands as fishing line.

We know it's impossible to carry your survival bag 24/7/365, so this is where having a survival bracelet can help you.

Be ready to respond in however life comes at you. Raise awareness. Fight MS.

FREE SHIPPING.

**EVERY PURCHASE OF ONE RUSTIC RIBBON COMES WITH ONE RIBBON MINI THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2013.


NOTE: When it comes to knowing the measurement of your wrist read the directions immediately following. Easiest way to measure: get a piece of yarn or string and measure it around the area you would like your bracelet to sit. Remove and place next to a ruler to find out the size. Average size is 6.5 inches and goes all the way up to even 10.5 inches or larger.

name: Lindabug Ribbon
description:
Linda Thompson has journeyed with MS since 1988. MS, or Multiple Sclerosis, is the leading cause of neurological disability among young adults worldwide. It has the highest rates of depression among all disabilities, above that of cancer, substance withdrawals, and epilepsy. Multiple Sclerosis robs people of emotional strength, mental stability, spiritual wellness, and physical endurance.

25 years later, Linda is a mom of Endless Pursuit Founder, Ry Thompson. EP is one of the first nationwide faith organizations to directly combat Multiple Sclerosis. She serves as an Honorary Board Member, a constant advisor to the entire team. Ry Thompson has had MS since 2006.

Stopping the journey there would only be at the beginning. November of 2013 Linda was diagnosed with Colon Cancer. Now facing chemo and a long recovery process, bills are piling up and finances are hard to grasp. Join us as we gather around our beloved Linda. Always full of joy and a smile when called Lindabug from her little niece, we thought it fitting to name a bracelet after this pillar of God.

Linda impacts thousands around the globe that live with Multiple Sclerosis and is a local leader in the PNW. She has resided in a small Washington state town for the past 24 years and works at a local doctor's clinic. Happily married with two adult children.

All profit from this bracelet goes to Linda as a blessing to help her in her bills and time of need. Blue represents the color of Colon Cancer and orange represents the color of Multiple Sclerosis awareness.

--------------------

Paracord or 550 cord is one of the most important things that you'd like to have in an emergency situation. It was originally used by paratroopers as suspension lines for their parachutes during World War II. Most military units have been using paracord for years to tie down gear on vehicles, securing camouflage nets, and carrying small but important items. In 1997, paracord was even used by astronauts during STS-82 Space Shuttle Discovery mission to repair the Hubble Space Telescope. You can use paracord to repair gear or torn clothing, replace broken shoe laces, apply a tourniquet, make a splint or use the inner strands as fishing line.

We know it's impossible to carry your survival bag 24/7/365, so this is where having a survival bracelet can help you.

Be ready to respond in however life comes at you. Raise awareness. Fight MS AND Colon Cancer.

FREE SHIPPING.


NOTE: When it comes to knowing the measurement of your wrist read the directions immediately following. Easiest way to measure: get a piece of yarn or string and measure it around the area you would like your bracelet to sit. Remove and place next to a ruler to find out the size. Average size is 6.5 inches and goes all the way up to even 10.5 inches or larger.

name: Wristband
description: Our one inch silicone Endless Pursuit bracelets are designed to last, we put in the extra effort to give you a top of the line quality bracelet. Each of these bracelets features the words "Endless Pursuit" on one side and MS Awareness Orange coloring the inside of the bracelet. These wider bracelets are popular with young adults & teens! Great way to show your support for someone with Multiple Sclerosis. Adult size measures 8" around.
